intro: Anisophyllea manausensis, commonly known as the Manaus anisophyllea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with alternating leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
